Advanced.Enable duplicate page submissions: Yes - Enable page to be re-posted

Source.SQL Query:
select NAME,
       DISPLAY_NAME
  from AV_PLUGINS_V
 where application_id = :P0_APP_ID and
page_name is null

select a.authorization_scheme_name
from av_p0600_not_used_auth_schemes_v a
where a.application_id = :P0_APP_ID

select v.page_name
      ,v.page_id
      ,v.component_type
      ,v.component_name
from av_visibility_v v
where v.visibility_category = 'CONDITION'
and upper(v.visibility_type) = 'NEVER'
and v.application_id = :P0_APP_ID

Help.Help Text: To ensure the safety in your application, activate the Session State protection in your application. Keep in mind if you secure your items they cannot be changed inside JavaScript (Dynamic Actions).

Source.Used: Only when current value in session state is null

Help.Help Text:
Runtime API Usage should be restricted as much as possible. If you have a standard Application with no custom API calls it should be completely disabled.
The setting can be found in the shared components => Security in the section Database session. All Checkboxes should be uncheckd.
If you are using API-Calls try to only check the "Modify This Application" Checkbox.

Source.Used: Only when current value in session state is null

Help.Help Text:
Supporting legacy JavaScript means always to load more JavaScript as necessary.
This attribute can be found inside your application in the shared components => user interface page in the section "JavaScript". If one of the Checkboxes "Include Deprecated or Desupported Javascript Functions" is switched on it will return Yes.
For best performance and up-to-date JS calls switch "Pre 18.1" and "18.x" off.

Source.Used: Only when current value in session state is null

Help.Help Text: Using jQuery Migrate means, to support old deprecated JavaScript Code.

Source.Used: Only when current value in session state is null

Help.Help Text: If you don't select Universal Theme for your application, not the full functionality is supported.

Source.Used: Only when current value in session state is null

Help.Help Text:
If using Universal Theme, this information shows the version compared to the APEX version
UT 22.1 = APEX 22.1
UT 21.2 = APEX 21.2
UT 21.1 = APEX 21.1
UT 1.6 = APEX 20.2
UT 1.5 = APEX 20.1
UT 1.4 = APEX 19.2
UT 1.3 = APEX 19.1
UT 1.2 = APEX 18.1 / 18.2
UT 1.1 = APEX 5.1
UT 1.0 = APEX 5.0

Settings.PL\/SQL Code:
select
 a.compatibility_mode
,a.Session_State_Protection
,nvl2(a.runtime_api_usage, replace(replace(replace(a.runtime_api_usage,'T','This'),'O','Other'),'W','Workspace'),'None')
into
 :P600_COMPATIBILITY_MODE
,:P600_SESSION_STATE_PROTECTION
,:P600_RUNTIME_API_USAGE
from apex_applications a
where a.application_id = :P0_APP_ID;

select 
 ui.include_legacy_javascript 
,ui.include_jquery_migrate
into
 :P600_INCLUDE_LEGACY_JAVASCRIPT
,:P600_INCLUDE_JQUERY_MIGRATE
from apex_appl_user_interfaces ui 
where ui.application_id = :P0_APP_ID
and ui.ui_type_name = 'DESKTOP';

select 
 t.theme_name 
,replace(substr(t.file_prefix,instr(t.file_prefix,'theme_42') + 9),'/')
into 
 :P600_THEME_NAME
,:P600_UT_VERSION
from apex_application_themes t
where t.application_id = :P0_APP_ID
and t.ui_type_name = 'DESKTOP';
